item.title: The Fed is unlikely to cut rates Wednesday, but this meeting is packed with intrigue
item.description: Considering nothing is likely to happen when it comes to major policy decisions, the meeting promises several fascinating subplots.

item.title: Private company hiring bounced back with a 104,000 increase in July, ADP says
item.description: Payrolls rose by a seasonally adjusted 104,000 for the month, reversing a loss of 23,000 in June.

item.title: U.S. economy grew at a 3% rate in Q2, a better-than-expected pace even as Trump's tariffs hit
item.description: Gross domestic product was expected to grow at a 2.3% annualized pace in the second quarter, according to the consensus estimate.

item.title: Companies from Stanley Black & Decker to Conagra are saying tariffs will cost them hundreds of millions
item.description: Businesses in a range of industries have raced to figure out how to handle rising costs in the middle of a shakeup in global trade policy.

item.title: Euro zone economy ekes out better-than-expected 0.1% growth in second quarter
item.description: Attention has focused on how tariffs may impact Europe's economies.
